result.execSummary:
The defendant Alvon Leonard Cotton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Recklessly Cause Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(3)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Extended Supervision and Probation conditions same

miscConds.notes: Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges due during term of probation, bail to apply, if revoked to be paid from 25% of prison funds, balance paid during extended supervision to be collected by DOC, failure to pay results in a civil judgment. Court WAIVED all NON-mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges.

No contact with firearms.
Court advised due to felon conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession

No contact with Carletha W. and her minor children, and no contact with J.W., or any other minor children unless approved by agent or court. 
No physcial discipline of any minor child.

Batterer's Intervention program.
Parenting classes.
Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
Provide DNA sample.
Court advised defenant of right to seek post conviction relief.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.
Voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

timeConds.notes:
STAYED pending review on 12-19-14

**12-19-14/PRH**
Defendant is non-compliance with probations conditions. Defendant is to serve 3 days STRAIGHT TIME; FORTHWITH, with no good time credit.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alvon Leonard Cotton

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Alvon Leonard Cotton in court.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Doc Agent also in Court.  Defendant doing well on Probation.  No further reviews are requested.

Defendant Alvon Leonard Cotton in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Evan Glaberson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Court admonished defendant for non-compliance and ordered defendant to serve 3 DAYS of the condition time; straight time; forthwith.  Commitment For Condition Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions - Domestic Violence Court signed and filed.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for May 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Alvon Leonard Cotton in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Defendant Alvon Leonard Cotton in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant. Court reviewed and returned photographs.
AS TO COUNT 1
The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 2 YEARS, consecutive, credit for 5 DAYS time served, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 1 YEAR, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 YEAR. Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 24 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION
-Serve 100 DAYS in the House of Correction as Condition Time, STAYED pending review.
-Batterers Intervention program.
-Parenting classes.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No contact with Carletha, W. and her minor children, and no contact with J.W., or any  other minor children unless approved by agent or court. 
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No physical discipline of any minor child.
-Obtain GED/HSED.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges due during term of probation, bail to apply, if revoked to be paid from 25% of prison funds, balance paid during Extended Supervision to be collected by DOC, failure to pay results in a civil judgment.
-Court WAIVED all NON-Mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges.
-Provide DNA Sample.

*Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program OR the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief. 
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER. 
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for December 19, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER. Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored. Case adjourned to branch 23 for Sentencing.

Defendant Alvon Leonard Cotton in court with attorney Debra J Patterson.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Plea & Sentencing. Received & Filed, Amended Information.
AS TO COUNT 1 Per Amended Information.
On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Physical Abuse of a Child (Reckless Causation of Bodily Harm), contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 948.03(3)(b), 939.50(3)(i), a Class I Felony.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 11, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Alvon Leonard Cotton in court with attorney Debra J Patterson.  Katryna L Childs for Cynthia Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advised the court that the defendant wishes to enter a plea. Court began plea colloquy with defendant. Court STOPPED colloquy, discussion regarding possible amendment to Count 1. Court vacated Jury Trial date, and adjourned case for a Plea & Sentencing to branch 23.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 22, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Alvon Leonard Cotton in court with attorney Debra J Patterson.  Cynthia M Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defense counsel requests case be set for Status Conference. Court set matter for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial.  All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial to branch 23.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for July 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Signed & Filed, Stipulation and Order Regarding Use of Videotaped Statments.

Defendant Alvon Leonard Cotton in court with Tricia Fritz supervised by attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Cynthia M. Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for Preliminary Hearing. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver, received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial before Judge Grady, Branch 23. Original Information, received and filed. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defendant plead not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 23.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.

14RM017128  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
03-26-14

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with J.W. (DOB:  08/20/2007) and J.T. (DOB:  07/18/2009).

Defendant Alvon Leonard Cotton in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Defendant Alvon Leonard Cotton in custody.  Karine E. O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
